attributes.action: Share £50 Billion between UK tax payers
attributes.additional_details:
I suggest that The Bank of Englands £50 Billion of quantitative easing be given directly to UK tax payers in order to kick start the economy.

If this money was put straight into tax payers hands this could be pumped into the UK economy helping families and businesses. As a rough estimate Each tax payer would receive somewhere in the region of £1500. This has already been successfully done in Australia.
